profile.profileDescription: Profile for the INBO natural science collection

label.name: Objects higher hiÃ«rarchy: relevant groupings of NS objects

label.name_singular: Identification event following the Botanical Nomenclatural Code
label.name_plural: Identification events following the Botanical Nomenclatural Code

label.name_plural: Identification events following the Zoological Nomenclatural Code

label.name: Restriction in use that applies to object

label.name_singular: No open publishing of sequence data
Physical access only under specified conditions (e.g. dangerous for health)
No transfer within the institute (internal loans)
No transfer to third parties (external loans)

label.name: Restriction in use that applies to object
Parent type on which the sampling was execute
Parent type on which the sampling was execute
Parent type on which the sampling was execute

item.idno: C3 (Littoral zone of inland surface waterbodies)
D2 (Valley mires, poor fens and transition mires)
D4 (Base-rich fens and calcareous spring mires)
D5 (Sedge and reedbeds, normally without free-standing water)
E5 (Woodland fringes and clearings and tall forb stands)
G5 (Lines of trees, small anthropogenic woodlands, recently felled woodland, early-stage woodland and coppice)
H1 (Terrestrial underground caves, cave systems, passages and waterbodies)
H3 (Inland cliffs, rock pavements and outcrops)
H5 (Miscellaneous inland habitats with very sparse or no vegetation)
I2 (Cultivated areas of gardens and parks)
J1 (Buildings of cities, towns and villages)
J4 (Transport networks and other constructed hard-surfaced areas)
J5 (Highly artificial man-made waters and associated structures)

label.name_singular: no indication of being currently reproductive
label.name_plural: no indication of being currently reproductive

label.name: Parent type on which the sampling was execute
Parent type on which the sampling was execute

label.name_singular: Aangetast hoogveen waar herstel nog mogelijk is (7120)
label.name_plural: Aangetast hoogveen waar herstel nog mogelijk is (7120)

label.name_singular: Droge kalkgraslanden en struweel op kalkbodem (6210)
label.name_plural: Droge kalkgraslanden en struweel op kalkbodem (6210)

label.name_singular: Eiken-Beukenbossen met Wilde hyacint en Parelgras-Beukenbossen (9130)
label.name_plural: Eiken-Beukenbossen met Wilde hyacint en Parelgras-Beukenbossen (9130)

label.name_singular: Eiken-Beukenbossen en Eiken-Berkenbossen op zure bodems (9120_9190)
label.name_plural: Eiken-Beukenbossen en Eiken-Berkenbossen op zure bodems (9120_9190)

label.name_plural: restriction in reuse of generated objects

settings.setting: Cataloguing status (at start of CMS session)
Date that the object was created

Object identifier (preferred). In DwC terms this is th recordNumber: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.
Fieldwork (e.g. expedition, survey) of which the object is a result
(if applicable:) The object is a subsample of
The object is part of the population
The object has the genetic entity
The object is material from the plot

The object or a subsample of the object is loaned or donated

role.name: Administrators
role.description: Confers actions needed by those administering the system

role.name: Cataloguers
role.description: Confers actions needed by those editing catalogue entries

role.name: Researcher
role.description: Allows users to only search and view - but not edit - catalogue entries

role.name: User content moderator
role.description: Allows users to moderate user generated tags and comments

group.name: Cataloguers
group.description: Users who can add and edit catalogue entries
